secText: In this second simulation, instead of using two wave pulses, you will combine two traveling waves as they move toward one another. You determine the amplitudes and wavelengths of these waves. Again, set the parameters of the waves and press GO to see the result of combining the waves.

Can you create a single combined wave that does not move either to the left or to the right? If you do, you will have created what is called a “standing wave.” Hint: try making the settings of the two waves identical, except for travel direction.
